result.execSummary:
The defendant William Bradley Slawson IV was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Vehicle Operator Flee/Elude Officer, a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 346.04(3).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Concurrent with 15CT224 and 15CF987.
IS eligible for Challenge and Substance Abuse programs.

superMiscConds.notes: $518.00 costs DOC COLLECT.    If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.

gonzalez

Defendant William Bradley Slawson in court in custody with attorney Jason C. Gonzalez.  Richard Jay Sullivan appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Testimony take, witness identified defendant. State moves for bind over, 
Court finds PROBABLE CAUSE and defendant is bound over.   Information filed, copy to Defendant, reading waived.   Defendant pleads not guilty and jury trial to be set. 
Bond modification addressed by defense, state objects. Court DENIES bond modification. Bond continued.
